question: <image 1> is the Ethos, Pathos, Logos, Aristotle (350 BC) model. When you present a point, your goal is to convince or persuade your audience that your idea is valid. For this reason, the Greek philosopher Aristotle divided persuasion methods into three categories. Which one is not included?
description: The image depicts an ancient Greek vase with intricate designs and inscriptions. The vase features a central figure, likely representing the Greek philosopher Aristotle, who is pointing towards three words: "LOGOS," "ETHOS," and "PATHOS." These words are written in uppercase letters and are arranged in a triangular formation around the figure. The figure appears to be engaged in a speech or lecture, emphasizing these three terms. The vase itself has a classical design with decorative patterns and handles on either side. The overall style suggests it is an artistic representation of Aristotle's concepts of persuasion.
